The "Social Security Court of Appeals Act" establishes a Court of Appeals for the Social Security Circuit, increasing the number of circuits to fourteen and adding Social Security as a circuit covering all Federal judicial districts. SEC. 6. Effective Date: The Act and its amendments will take effect 180 days after enactment and apply to appeals filed on or after the effective date.
